entries.name: Ammunition
entries: Requires ammo, drawn as part of attack. After combat, spend 1 minute to recover half expended.
Treat as improvised weapon for melee (slings must be loaded).

entries.name: Ammunition
entries: Requires ammo, drawn as part of attack. After combat, spend 1 minute to recover half expended.
Treat as improvised weapon for melee (slings must be loaded).

entries.name: Burst Fire
entries: Can spray a 10-foot-cube area in normal range; each creature in area makes DC 15 Dex save or take weapon's damage (uses ten pieces of ammo).

entries.name: Finesse
entries: Your choice of your Str or Dex modifier for attack and damage rolls. Same modifier for both rolls.

entries.name: Heavy
entries: Small/Tiny creatures have disadvantage on attack rolls.

entries.name: Loading
entries: Can fire only once regardless of the number of attacks you can normally make.

entries.name: Reach
entries: Adds 5 feet to your reach.

entries.name: Reload
entries: Reload this weapon using an action or bonus action (your choice).

entries.name: Thrown
entries: Throw this weapon as a ranged attack. If it is a melee weapon, use the ability modifier for the attack and damage roll that you would use for a melee attack.

entries.name: Two-Handed
entries: Requires two hands to attack with.

entries.name: Versatile
entries: Use the damage in parentheses when making a melee attack with two hands.

reducedItemType.name: Artisan's Tools
entries: Proficiency grants proficiency bonus to ability checks you make using these tools.

reducedItemType.name: Gaming Set
entries: Proficiency grants proficiency bonus to ability checks you make to play a game with that set.

reducedItemType.name: Instrument
entries: Proficiency grants proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument.

entries.name: Range
entries: Given as two numbers; normal and max. Attacks beyond normal range have disadvantage.

reducedItemType.name: Trade Good
entries: Most wealth is not in coins. Merchants commonly exchange trade goods without using currency.

entries.name: Crew
entries: A ship needs a crew of skilled hirelings to function (2gp per day each).

If at least half the crew becomes disloyal (see the loyalty rules in chapter 4 of the DMG) during a voyage, the crew turns hostile and stages a mutiny. If the ship is berthed, disloyal crew members leave and never return.

entries.name: Passengers
entries: A ship outfitted with private accommodations can carry one-fifth as many passengers as show.
Ship accommodation costs 5 sp per day for a hammock, or 2 gp per day for a small cabin.

entries.name: Damage Threshold
entries: If a ship has a Damage Threshold, it has immunity to all damage unless it takes an amount of damage equal to or greater than its damage threshold, in which case it takes damage as normal.

entries.name: Ship Repair
entries: Repairing 1 hit point of damage requires 1 day while berthed and costs 20 gp.
